org.ossnipes.snipes.lib.irc
Class IRCBase

java.lang.Object
  org.ossnipes.snipes.lib.irc.IRCBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
BotConstants, IRCConstants, IRCEventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExampleBot
public abstract class IRCBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRCConstants, BotConstants, IRCEventListener

Main class for the Snipes IRC framework. The Snipes IRC framework is a framework that is meant to replace the current implementation of IRC communication in The Open Source Snipes Project (PircBot) so that the project can "stand on it's own two feet" and be able to change from license to license as the author sees fit. There was also a need for SSL support, so that is built into the framework with the SnipesSSLSocketFactory class.

Since:
Snipes 0.6

Constructor Detail

IRCBase

public IRCBase()
Method Detail

register

public final Event[] register()
Registers this class for listening of events. This does not apply to us, as we are a IRCBase, given extra power by the event sending mechanism to "enforce the rules" of who gets what events sent to them. This method is never called, and is thus empty.

Specified by:
register in interface IRCEventListener

isDebugging

public boolean isDebugging()

connect

public IRCBase connect(java.lang.String server,
                       int port,
                       javax.net.SocketFactory factory)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.net.UnknownHostException
Connects to the IRC server.

Parameters:
server - The server IP/host to connect to. If null, a IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
port - The port to connect on. If it is not between 1 and 65535, throws IllegalArgumentException.
factory - The SocketFactory to use. If null, a SnipesSocketFactory is used.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is a unknown IO error while connecting to the server.
java.net.UnknownHostException - If the host specified by "server" doesn't exist.

connect

public IRCBase connect(java.lang.String server,
                       int port)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.net.UnknownHostException
Connects to the IRC server using a SnipesSocketFactory.

Parameters:
server - The server IP/host to connect to. If null, a IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
port - The port to connect on. If it is not between 1 and 65535, throws IllegalArgumentException.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is a unknown IO error while connecting to the server.
java.net.UnknownHostException - If the host specified by "server" doesn't exist.
See Also:
connect(String, int, SocketFactory)

connect

public IRCBase connect(java.lang.String server)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.net.UnknownHostException
Connects to the IRC server using a SnipesSocketFactory and the default port (see below.)

Parameters:
server - The server IP/host to connect to. If null, a IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there is a unknown IO error while connecting to the server.
java.net.UnknownHostException - If the host specified by "server" doesn't exist.
See Also:
connect(String, int, SocketFactory), for the port used by default by Snipes. I won't specify it here, as it may change.

setTopic

public void setTopic(java.lang.String channel,
                     java.lang.String topic)
Sets the topic of the specified channel. If the channel is mode +t (topic protection) then the bot will be required to have operator status in channel.

Parameters:
channel - The channel to set the topic of.
topic - The topic to set it to.

sendPong

public void sendPong(java.lang.String server)
Sends a PONG command to the server. A PONG command is the command to respond to a server's PING message (keeps us connected to the server.)

Parameters:
server - The server to specify in the PONG command.

who

public void who(java.lang.String name)
Sends a IRC WHO command, sending IRC_RESPONSE_CODE events for the different parts of the WHO response.

Parameters:
name - The name of the user, or the mask to use.

part

public void part(java.lang.String channel)
Parts (leaves) the specified channel.

Parameters:
channel - The channel to leave.

kick

public void kick(java.lang.String user,
                 java.lang.String channel,
                 java.lang.String reason)
Kicks a user from a channel.

Parameters:
user - The nick of the user to kick. May be a comma-separated list (no spaces)
channel - The channel to kick from. If user was a comma separated list, this should also be one, specifying the channels to kick from.
reason - The reason to use for kicking. The protocol does not allow for specification of the reasons to be used for each user of a comma-separated list, so this will be treated as a single String. If this is null, a reason will not be given. (The server may fill it in for you with something like your nick.)

kick

public void kick(java.lang.String user,
                 java.lang.String channel)
Kicks a user from a channel. Calling this method is the same as kick(user,channel,null)

Parameters:
user - The nick of the user to kick. May be a comma-separated list (no spaces)
channel - The channel to kick from. If user was a comma separated list, this should also be one, specifying the channels to kick from.

sendNotice

public void sendNotice(java.lang.String to,
                       java.lang.String msg)
Sends a IRC NOTICE command to the server. NOTICEs are generally used for automatic responses. As such, NOTICEs are not counted in idle time.

Parameters:
to - The user or channel to send the NOTICE to.
msg - The message to send as the body of the command.

disconnect

public void disconnect(java.lang.String msg)

setMode

public void setMode(java.lang.String channel,
                    java.lang.String mode,
                    java.lang.String params)
Sets a mode on a channel or user with the specified parameters.

Parameters:
channel - The channel to set the mode on. e.x.: "#Snipes"
mode - The mode to set. e.x.: "+qo".
params - The parameters to use. e.x.: "Unix Unix" (with mode +qo). May be null. If it is, no parameters are sent. Instead of providing null, try setMode(String, String).

                    java.lang.String mode)

public IRCBase setNick(java.lang.String nick)
Sets the bot's nick. If we are connected to a server, the server will be notified of the nick change.

Parameters:
nick - The nick to change to.

setRealname

public IRCBase setRealname(java.lang.String name)
Sets the bot's realname. This should be called before connecting to a server, as there is no way in the protocol to change the realname after the original USER command.

Parameters:
name -
Returns:

sendEvent

public void sendEvent(Event ev,
                      EventArgs args)
Sends a event to the bot, checking if it is a internal one, and if it is, it calls the appropriate method. Really just a alias for BotUtils.sendEvent(Event, EventArgs, IRCBase) with this as the third argument :).

Parameters:
ev - The event to send.
args - The arguments to use.
